summary.para: Sets the relaystate of the message.
If the message being built is a response message, the relaystate will be included unmodified.
If the message being built is a request message, the relaystate will be encoded and compressed before being included.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Bindings.Saml2PostBinding.CertificateIncludeOption
member.summary: [Optional] Default EndCertOnly (Only the end certificate is included in the X.509 chain information).

member.summary: Html post content.

member.summary: Set a Dictionary of key value pairs as a Query string in the Relay State.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2BindingExtensions.GetRelayStateQuery(ITfoxtec.Saml2.Bindings.Saml2Binding)
member.summary: Get the Relay State Query string as a Dictionary of key value pairs.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2ResponseExtensions.CreateSession(ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2AuthnResponse,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a Claims Principal and a Federated Authentication Session for the authenticated user.
member.param: The period from the current time during which the token is valid. The ValidFrom property will be set to UtcNow and the ValidTo property will be set to ValidFrom plus the period specified by this parameter. Default lifetime is 10 Hours.

In reference mode, a simple artifact is produced during serialization and the token material is stored in the token cache that is associated with the token handler. The token cache is an instance of a class that derives from SessionSecurityTokenCache. For Web Farm scenarios, the token cache must operate across all nodes in the farm.
If the IsPersistent property is true, the cookie is written as a persistent cookie. Persistent cookies remain valid after the browser is closed until they expire.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2ResponseExtensions.DeleteSession(ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Response)
member.summary: Delete the current Federated Authentication Session.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2AuthnRequest
member.summary: Saml2 Authn Request.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2AuthnRequest.ForceAuthn
member.summary: [Optional] A Boolean value. If "true", the identity provider MUST authenticate the presenter directly rather than rely on a previous security context. If a value is not provided, the default is "false". However, if both ForceAuthn and IsPassive are "true", the identity provider MUST NOT freshly authenticate the presenter unless the constraints of IsPassive can be met.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2AuthnRequest.IsPassive
member.summary: [Optional] A Boolean value. If "true", the identity provider and the user agent itself MUST NOT visibly take control of the user interface from the requester and interact with the presenter in a noticeable fashion. If a value is not provided, the default is "false".

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2AuthnRequest.NameIdPolicy
member.summary: Specifies constraints on the name identifier to be used to represent the requested subject. If omitted, then any type of identifier supported by the identity provider for the requested subject can be used, constrained by any relevant deployment-specific policies, with respect to privacy, for example.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2LogoutResponse
member.summary: Saml2 Logout Response.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2LogoutResponse.InResponseTo
member.summary: [Optional] A reference to the identifier of the request to which the response corresponds, if any. If the response is not generated in response to a request, or if the ID attribute value of a request cannot be determined (for example, the request is malformed), then this attribute MUST NOT be present. Otherwise, it MUST

member.summary: Saml2 Logout Request.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2LogoutRequest.NotOnOrAfter
member.summary: [Optional] The time at which the request expires, after which the recipient may discard the message. The time value is encoded in UTC, as described in Section 1.3.3.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2LogoutRequest.Reason
member.summary: [Optional] An indication of the reason for the logout, in the form of a URI reference.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2LogoutRequest.NameId
member.summary: [Required] The identifier and associated attributes (in plaintext or encrypted form) that specify the principal as currently recognized by the identity and service providers prior to this request. (For more information on this element, see Section 2.2.)

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2LogoutRequest.SessionIndex
member.summary: [Optional] The identifier that indexes this session at the message recipient.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Request
member.summary: Generic Saml2 Request.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Request.Id
member.summary: [Required] An identifier for the request. It is of type xs:ID and MUST follow the requirements specified in Section 1.3.4 for identifier uniqueness. The values of the ID attribute in a request and the InResponseTo attribute in the corresponding response MUST match.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Request.Version
member.summary: [Required] The version of this request. The identifier for the version of SAML defined in this specification is "2.0". SAML versioning is discussed in Section 4.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Request.IssueInstant
member.summary: [Required] The time instant of issue of the request. The time value is encoded in UTC, as described in Section 1.3.3.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Request.Destination
member.summary: [Optional] A URI reference indicating the address to which this request has been sent. This is useful to prevent malicious forwarding of requests to unintended recipients, a protection that is required by some protocol bindings. If it is present, the actual recipient MUST check that the URI reference identifies the location at which the message was received. If it does not, the request MUST be discarded. Some protocol bindings may require the use of this attribute (see [SAMLBind]).

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Request.Consent
member.summary: [Optional] Indicates whether or not (and under what conditions) consent has been obtained from a principal in the sending of this request. See Section 8.4 for some URI references that MAY be used as the value of the Consent attribute and their associated descriptions. If no Consent value is provided, the identifier urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:consent:unspecified (see Section 8.4.1) is in effect.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Request.Issuer
member.summary: [Optional] Identifies the entity that generated the response message. (For more information on this element, see Section 2.2.5.)

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Response
member.summary: Generic Saml2 Response.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Saml2Response.Status
member.summary: [Required] A code representing the status of the corresponding request.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes
member.summary: Authentication context is defined as the information, additional to the authentication assertion itself, that the relying party may require before it makes an entitlements decision with respect to an authentication assertion. Such context may include, but is not limited to, the actual authentication method used (see the SAML assertions and protocols specification [SAMLCore] for more information).

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.InternetProtocol
member.summary: The Internet Protocol class is applicable when a principal is authenticated through the use of a provided IP address.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.InternetProtocolPassword
member.summary: The Internet Protocol Password class is applicable when a principal is authenticated through the use of a provided IP address, in addition to a username/password.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.Kerberos
member.summary: [Supported by AD FS 2.0] This class is applicable when the principal has authenticated using a password to a local authentication authority, in order to acquire a Kerberos ticket. That Kerberos ticket is then used for subsequent network authentication.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.IntegratedWindowsAuthentication
member.summary: [Supported by AD FS 2.0]

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.MobileOneFactorUnregistered
member.summary: Reflects no mobile customer registration procedures and an authentication of the mobile device without requiring explicit end-user interaction. This context class authenticates only the device and never the user; it is useful when services other than the mobile operator want to add a secure device authentication to their authentication process.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.MobileTwoFactorUnregistered
member.summary: Reflects no mobile customer registration procedures and a two-factor based authentication, such as secure device and user PIN. This context class is useful when a service other than the mobile operator wants to link their customer ID to a mobile supplied two-factor authentication service by capturing mobile phone data at enrollment.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.MobileOneFactorContract
member.summary: Reflects mobile contract customer registration procedures and a single factor authentication. For example, a digital signing device with tamper resistant memory for key storage, such as the mobile MSISDN, but no required PIN or biometric for real-time user authentication.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.MobileTwoFactorContract
member.summary: Reflects mobile contract customer registration procedures and a two-factor based authentication. For example, a digital signing device with tamper resistant memory for key storage, such as a GSM SIM, that requires explicit proof of user identity and intent, such as a PIN or biometric.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.UserNameAndPassword
member.summary: [Supported by AD FS 2.0] The Password class is applicable when a principal authenticates to an authentication authority through the presentation of a password over an unprotected HTTP session.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.PasswordProtectedTransport
member.summary: [Supported by AD FS 2.0] The PasswordProtectedTransport class is applicable when a principal authenticates to an authentication authority through the presentation of a password over a protected session.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.SecureRemotePassword
member.summary: The Secure Remote Password class is applicable when the authentication was performed by means of Secure Remote Password as specified in [RFC 2945].

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.PreviousSession
member.summary: The PreviousSession class is applicable when a principal had authenticated to an authentication authority at some point in the past using any authentication context supported by that authentication authority. Consequently, a subsequent authentication event that the authentication authority will assert to the relying party may be significantly separated in time from the principal's current resource access request.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.X509Certificate
member.summary: [Supported by AD FS 2.0] The X509 context class indicates that the principal authenticated by means of a digital signature where the key was validated as part of an X.509 Public Key Infrastructure.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.PublicKeyPgp
member.summary: The PGP context class indicates that the principal authenticated by means of a digital signature where the key was validated as part of a PGP Public Key Infrastructure.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.PublicKeySpki
member.summary: The SPKI context class indicates that the principal authenticated by means of a digital signature where the key was validated via an SPKI Infrastructure.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.PublicKeyXmlDigitalDignature
member.summary: This context class indicates that the principal authenticated by means of a digital signature according to the processing rules specified in the XML Digital Signature specification [XMLSig].

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.Smartcard
member.summary: The Smartcard class is identified when a principal authenticates to an authentication authority using a smartcard.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.SmartcardPKI
member.summary: The SmartcardPKI class is applicable when a principal authenticates to an authentication authority through a two-factor authentication mechanism using a smartcard with enclosed private key and a PIN.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.SoftwarePki
member.summary: The Software-PKI class is applicable when a principal uses an X.509 certificate stored in software to authenticate to the authentication authority.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.Telephony
member.summary: This class is used to indicate that the principal authenticated via the provision of a fixed-line telephone number, transported via a telephony protocol such as ADSL.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.TelephonyNomad
member.summary: Indicates that the principal is "roaming" (perhaps using a phone card) and authenticates via the means of the line number, a user suffix, and a password element.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.TelephonyPersonal
member.summary: This class is used to indicate that the principal authenticated via the provision of a fixed-line telephone number and a user suffix, transported via a telephony protocol such as ADSL.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.TelephonyAuthenticated
member.summary: Indicates that the principal authenticated via the means of the line number, a user suffix, and a password element.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.TransportLayerSecurityClient
member.summary: [Supported by AD FS 2.0] This class indicates that the principal authenticated by means of a client certificate, secured with the SSL/TLS transport.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.TimeSyncToken
member.summary: The TimeSyncToken class is applicable when a principal authenticates through a time synchronization token.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextClassTypes.Unspecified
member.summary: The Unspecified class indicates that the authentication was performed by unspecified means.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.AuthnContextComparisonTypes
member.summary: Comparison methods.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes
member.summary: The following identifiers MAY be used in the Consent attribute defined on the RequestAbstractType and StatusResponseType complex types to communicate whether a principal gave consent, and under what conditions, for the message.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes.Unspecified
member.summary: No claim as to principal consent is being made.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes.Obtained
member.summary: Indicates that a principal’s consent has been obtained by the issuer of the message.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes.Prior
member.summary: Indicates that a principal’s consent has been obtained by the issuer of the message at some point prior to the action that initiated the message.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes.Implicit
member.summary: Indicates that a principal’s consent has been implicitly obtained by the issuer of the message during the action that initiated the message, as part of a broader indication of consent. Implicit consent is typically more proximal to the action in time and presentation than prior consent, such as part of a session of activities.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes.Explicit
member.summary: Indicates that a principal’s consent has been explicitly obtained by the issuer of the message during the action that initiated the message.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes.Unavailable
member.summary: Indicates that the issuer of the message did not obtain consent.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ConsentIdentifierTypes.Inapplicable
member.summary: Indicates that the issuer of the message does not believe that they need to obtain or report consent.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AssertionConsumerService
member.summary: Describe indexed endpoints that support the profiles of the Authentication Request protocol defined in [SAMLProf]. All service providers support at least one such endpoint, by definition.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AssertionConsumerService.#ctor(System.Uri,System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress)
member.param: [Required] A required attribute that specifies the SAML binding supported by the endpoint. Each binding is assigned a URI to identify it.
[Required] A required URI attribute that specifies the location of the endpoint. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AssertionConsumerService.Binding
member.summary: [Required] A required attribute that specifies the SAML binding supported by the endpoint. Each binding is assigned a URI to identify it.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AssertionConsumerService.Location
member.summary: [Required] A required URI attribute that specifies the location of the endpoint. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AttributeConsumingService
member.summary: The AttributeConsumingService element defines a particular service offered by the service provider in terms of the attributes the service requires or desires.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AttributeConsumingService.#ctor(ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ServiceName,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.RequestedAttribute})
member.param: [Required] Language-qualified names for the service.
[Required] A required element specifying attributes required or desired by this service.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AttributeConsumingService.ServiceName
member.summary: [Required] Language-qualified names for the service.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.AttributeConsumingService.RequestedAttributes
member.summary: [Required] A required element specifying attributes required or desired by this service.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ContactPerson
member.summary: The ContactPerson element specifies basic contact information about a person responsible in some capacity for a SAML entity or role. The use of this element is always optional. Its content is informative in nature and does not directly map to any core SAML elements or attributes.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ContactPerson.ContactType
member.summary: [Required] Specifies the type of contact using the ContactTypeType enumeration. The possible values are technical, support, administrative, billing, and other.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ContactPerson.Company
member.summary: [Optional] Optional string element that specifies the name of the company for the contact person.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ContactPerson.GivenName
member.summary: [Optional] Optional string element that specifies the given (first) name of the contact person.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ContactPerson.SurName
member.summary: [Optional] Optional string element that specifies the surname of the contact person.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ContactPerson.EmailAddress
member.summary: [Optional] Optional string element containing mailto: URIs representing e-mail addresses belonging to the contact person.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.ContactPerson.TelephoneNumber
member.summary: [Optional] Optional string element specifying a telephone number of the contact person.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor
member.summary: The EntitiesDescriptor element contains the metadata for an optionally named group of SAML entities.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.#ctor(System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.EndpointReference,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.param: [Required] Specifies the unique identifier of the SAML entity whose metadata is described by the element's contents.
An metadata XML signature that authenticates the containing element and its contents.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.EntityId
member.summary: Specifies the unique identifier of the SAML entity whose metadata is described by the element's contents.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.Id
member.summary: A document-unique identifier for the element, typically used as a reference point when signing.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.MetadataSigningCertificate
member.summary: [Optional] An metadata XML signature that authenticates the containing element and its contents.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.CertificateIncludeOption
member.summary: [Optional] Default EndCertOnly (Only the end certificate is included in the X.509 chain information).

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.ValidUntil
member.summary:
[Optional] Optional attribute indicates the expiration time of the metadata contained in the element and any contained elements.
Metadata is valid until in days from now.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.SPSsoDescriptor
member.summary: [Required] The SPSSODescriptor element extends SSODescriptorType with content reflecting profiles specific to service providers.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.EntityDescriptor.ContactPerson
member.summary: [Optional] Optional element identifying various kinds of contact personnel.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SingleLogoutService
member.summary:
Elements of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the Single Logout profiles defined in [SAMLProf].
The complex type EndpointType describes a SAML protocol binding endpoint at which a SAML entity can be sent protocol messages. Various protocol or profile-specific metadata elements are bound to this type.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SingleLogoutService.#ctor(System.Uri,System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress)
member.param: [Required] A required attribute that specifies the SAML binding supported by the endpoint. Each binding is assigned a URI to identify it.
[Required] A required URI attribute that specifies the location of the endpoint. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: M:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SingleLogoutService.#ctor(System.Uri,System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress,System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress)
member.param: [Required] A required attribute that specifies the SAML binding supported by the endpoint. Each binding is assigned a URI to identify it.
[Required] A required URI attribute that specifies the location of the endpoint. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

[Optional] Optionally specifies a different location to which response messages sent as part of the protocol or profile should be sent. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SingleLogoutService.Binding
member.summary: [Required] A required attribute that specifies the SAML binding supported by the endpoint. Each binding is assigned a URI to identify it.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SingleLogoutService.Location
member.summary: [Required] A required URI attribute that specifies the location of the endpoint. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SingleLogoutService.ResponseLocation
member.summary: [Optional] Optionally specifies a different location to which response messages sent as part of the protocol or profile should be sent. The allowable syntax of this URI depends on the protocol binding.

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor
member.summary:
The SPSSODescriptor element extends SSODescriptorType with content reflecting profiles specific to service providers.
The SSODescriptorType abstract type is a common base type for the concrete types SPSSODescriptorType and IDPSSODescriptorType, described in subsequent sections. It extends RoleDescriptorType with elements reflecting profiles common to both identity providers and service providers that support SSO,

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.protocolSupportEnumeration
member.summary: A whitespace-delimited set of URIs that identify the set of protocol specifications supported by the role element. For SAML V2.0 entities, this set MUST include the SAML protocol namespace URI, urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.AuthnRequestsSigned
member.summary: [Optional] Optional attribute that indicates whether the samlp:AuthnRequest messages sent by this service provider will be signed. If omitted, the value is assumed to be false.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.WantAssertionsSigned
member.summary: [Optional] Optional attribute that indicates a requirement for the saml:Assertion elements received by this service provider to be signed. If omitted, the value is assumed to be false. This requirement is in addition to any requirement for signing derived from the use of a particular profile/binding combination.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.SigningCertificate
member.summary: [Optional] Signing Certificate for Key Descriptor

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.EncryptionCertificate
member.summary: [Optional] Encryption Certificate for Key Descriptor

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.CertificateIncludeOption
member.summary: [Optional] Default EndCertOnly (Only the end certificate is included in the X.509 chain information).

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.SingleLogoutService
member.summary: [Optional] Zero or one element of type EndpointType that describe endpoints that support the Single Logout profiles defined in [SAMLProf].

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.NameIDFormat
member.summary: [Optional] Zero or one element of type anyURI that enumerate the name identifier formats supported by this system entity acting in this role. See Section 8.3 of [SAMLCore] for some possible values for this element.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.AssertionConsumerService
member.summary: [Required] One element that describe indexed endpoints that support the profiles of the Authentication Request protocol defined in [SAMLProf]. All service providers support at least one such endpoint, by definition.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Metadata.SPSsoDescriptor.AttributeConsumingService
member.summary: [Optional] Zero or one element that describe an application or service provided by the service provider that requires or desires the use of SAML attributes.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ProcessingRules.User
member.summary: Specifies that the message is being sent because the principal wishes to terminate the indicated session.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.ProcessingRules.Admin
member.summary: Specifies that the message is being sent because an administrator wishes to terminate the indicated session for that principal.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.NameIdPolicy.AllowCreate
member.summary: A Boolean value used to indicate whether the identity provider is allowed, in the course of fulfilling the request, to create a new identifier to represent the principal. Defaults to "false". When "false", the requester constrains the identity provider to only issue an assertion to it if an acceptable identifier for the principal has already been established. Note that this does not prevent the identity provider from creating such identifiers outside the context of this specific request (for example, in advance for a large number of principals).

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.NameIdPolicy.Format
member.summary: Specifies the URI reference corresponding to a name identifier format defined in this or another specification (see Section 8.3 for examples). The additional value of urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameid-format:encrypted is defined specifically for use within this attribute to indicate a request that the resulting identifier be encrypted.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.NameIdPolicy.SPNameQualifier
member.summary: Optionally specifies that the assertion subject's identifier be returned (or created) in the namespace of a service provider other than the requester, or in the namespace of an affiliation group of service providers. See for example the definition of urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:nameidformat: persistent in Section 8.3.7.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.RequestedAuthnContext.Comparison
member.summary:
[Optional] Specifies the comparison method used to evaluate the requested context classes or statements, one of "exact", "minimum", "maximum", or "better". The default is "exact".
If Comparison is set to "exact" or omitted, then the resulting authentication context in the authentication statement MUST be the exact match of at least one of the authentication contexts specified. If Comparison is set to "minimum", then the resulting authentication context in the authentication statement MUST be at least as strong (as deemed by the responder) as one of the authentication contexts specified. If Comparison is set to "better", then the resulting authentication context in the authentication statement MUST be stronger (as deemed by the responder) than any one of the authentication contexts specified. If Comparison is set to "maximum", then the resulting authentication context in the authentication statement MUST be as strong as possible (as deemed by the responder) without exceeding the strength of at least one of the authentication contexts specified.

member.name: P:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.RequestedAuthnContext.AuthnContextClassRef
member.summary: [One or More] Specifies one or more URI references identifying authentication context classes or declarations. These elements are defined in Section 2.7.2.2. For more information about authentication context classes, see [SAMLAuthnCxt].

member.name: T:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes
member.summary: Status codes, mapped against states in section 3.2.2.2 in the SAML2 spec.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.Success
member.summary: The request succeeded.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.Requester
member.summary: The request could not be performed due to an error on the part of the requester.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.Responder
member.summary: The request could not be performed due to an error on the part of the SAML responder or SAML authority.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.VersionMismatch
member.summary: The SAML responder could not process the request because the version of the request message was incorrect.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.AuthnFailed
member.summary: The responding provider was unable to successfully authenticate the principal.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.InvalidAttrNameOrValue
member.summary: Unexpected or invalid content was encountered within a <saml:Attribute> or <saml:AttributeValue> element.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.InvalidNameIdPolicy
member.summary: The responding provider cannot or will not support the requested name identifier policy.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.NoAuthnContext
member.summary: The specified authentication context requirements cannot be met by the responder.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.NoAvailableIDP
member.summary: Used by an intermediary to indicate that none of the supported identity provider <Loc> elements in an <IDPList> can be resolved or that none of the supported identity providers are available.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.NoPassive
member.summary: Indicates the responding provider cannot authenticate the principal passively, as has been requested.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.NoSupportedIDP
member.summary: Used by an intermediary to indicate that none of the identity providers in an <IDPList> are supported by the intermediary.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.PartialLogout
member.summary: Used by a session authority to indicate to a session participant that it was not able to propagate logout to all other session participants.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.ProxyCountExceeded
member.summary: Indicates that a responding provider cannot authenticate the principal directly and is not permitted to proxy the request further.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.RequestDenied
member.summary: The SAML responder or SAML authority is able to process the request but has chosen not to respond. This status code MAY be used when there is concern about the security context of the request message or the sequence of request messages received from a particular requester.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.RequestUnsupported
member.summary: The SAML responder or SAML authority does not support the request.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.RequestVersionDeprecated
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot process any requests with the protocol version specified in the request.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.RequestVersionTooHigh
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot process the request because the protocol version specified in the request message is a major upgrade from the highest protocol version supported by the responder.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.RequestVersionTooLow
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot process the request because the protocol version specified in the request message is too low.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.ResourceNotRecognized
member.summary: The resource value provided in the request message is invalid or unrecognized.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.TooManyResponses
member.summary: The response message would contain more elements than the SAML responder is able to return.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.UnknownAttrProfile
member.summary: An entity that has no knowledge of a particular attribute profile has been presented with an attribute drawn from that profile.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.UnknownPrincipal
member.summary: The responding provider does not recognize the principal specified or implied by the request.

member.name: F:ITfoxtec.Saml2.Schemas.Saml2StatusCodes.UnsupportedBinding
member.summary: The SAML responder cannot properly fulfill the request using the protocol binding specified in the request.
